maml:description.maml:para: Import resources into the Organization

Uses the Ravello Import CLI to import resources into the Organization. The imported resources can be an ISO file on local storage, a vDisk stored on local storage or a VM from a vSPhere environment. This cmdlet assumes that the Ravello Import CLI is locally installed.
Path to the Ravello CLI VM Import Tool for Windows

Path to the VM's VMX file

dev:remarks.maml:para: The example will Publish the Application named App1, when the Test-RavelloApplicationPublished call returns $False. This means that some changes where made to the design of the application, but that these changes have not been published, or deployed, yet. The call to Publish-RavelloAppliaction selects the Cloud, the preferred region in the cloud and the optimization level. The available Clouds and the regions can be retrieved through the Get-RavelloApplicationPublishLocation cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Perform an action on an Application
Perform an action on a published Application. The allowed actions are PublishUpdates, Start, Stop, Restart and ResetDisks.
The ID of the Ravello Application

The Action to be performed on the Application. Following actions are accepted: PublishUpdates: updates the cloud according to the current Application data (design) Start: start all the application VMs Stop: stop all the application VMs Restart: restart all the application VMs ResetDisks: reset each of the VM disks to its most recent applicable state
Only valid in combination with the PublishUpdates action. When set, newly added VMs will start after the PublishUpdates action.
The name of the Ravello Application

The Action to be performed on the Application. Following actions are accepted: PublishUpdates: updates the cloud according to the current Application data (design) Start: start all the application VMs Stop: stop all the application VMs Restart: restart all the application VMs ResetDisks: reset each of the VM disks to its most recent applicable state
Only valid in combination with the PublishUpdates action. When set, newly added VMs will start after the PublishUpdates action.

Only valid in combination with the PublishUpdates action. When set, newly added VMs will start after the PublishUpdates action.
The name of the Ravello Application

maml:description.maml:para: Perform an action on or more VMs in an Application

Perform an action on or more VMs in a publsihed Application. The cmdlet doesn't wait for the actual completion of the Action. It comes back the moment the Action has been passed to the VMs in the Application.
The ID of the Ravello Application
The Name of the VM

The Action to take on the VM(s) The accepted actions are stop: stop the VM(s) start: start the VM(s) shutdown: shutdown the VM(s). Gracefull poweroff: poweroff the VM(s). This is non-gracefull restart: restart the VM(s) redeploy: shut down the VM(s) and replace it/them with a new copy repair: makes an attempt to repair the VM(s) without destroying the data resetDisk:

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Permission Filter
Creates a new Permission Filter. These Filters will be used in Permissions.
The name of the property that is used in the filter. The available properties for a resource type can be obtained with the Get-RavelloPermissionDescriptor cmdlet.

The Operator field provides the operation that is used on the field that is defined in the Property parameter. The available operators for a specific resource can be obtained with the Get-RavelloPermissionDescriptor cmdlet.

The content of this field depends on the Property and the Operand parameters. If for example, the Property is the Id field, then this will contain the long value against which the check will happen. Note that some resources do not foresee a Filter option.
The name of the property that is used in the filter. The available properties for a resource type can be obtained with the Get-RavelloPermissionDescriptor cmdlet.

The Operator field provides the operation that is used on the field that is defined in the Property parameter. The available operators for a specific resource can be obtained with the Get-RavelloPermissionDescriptor cmdlet.

The content of this field depends on the Property and the Operand parameters. If for example, the Property is the Id field, then this will contain the long value against which the check will happen. Note that some resources do not foresee a Filter option.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $app = Get-RavelloApplication -ApplicationName App1 $filter = New-RavelloPermissionFilter -Property ID -Operator Equals -Operand $app.id $perm = New-RavelloPermission -ResourceType APPLICATION -Action READ,EXECUTE -FilterOperand Or -Filter $filter

dev:remarks.maml:para: A new Permission is created. The Permission allows the Actions READ and EXECUTE on an Application. The Permission uses a Filter where the Id of Application is validated. The Id is obtained by running the Get-RavelloApplication cmdlet against the App1 Application

The way filters (see the Filter parameter) will be combined. Possible values are "And' and 'Or'

dev:remarks.maml:para: A new Permission is created. The Permission allows the Actions READ and EXECUTE on an Application. The Permission uses a Filter where the Id of Application is validated. The Id is obtained by running the Get-RavelloApplication cmdlet against the App1 Application

maml:description.maml:para: Get the URL to access the resources that are accessible through an Ephemeral Access token

The cmdlet returns the URL to access the resources for which the Ephemeral Access token defines access. One URL connects to the VM directly, like a console. The other URL provides access through a Ravello interface, where the user can also perform basic task (Start,Stop...) on the permitted VM resource.
The ID of the Ephemeral Token
The Name of the Ephemeral Token
The ID of the Ephemeral Token
The Name of the Ephemeral Token

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the URL for accessing the resource(s) that are defined in the Ephemeral Token. There are 2 URL returned: - the RavelloUI which opens a web interface siilar to the standard Ravello Web Gui, but limited to the resources for which the Ephemeral Token has permissions - a EndUserUI: only available when the Ephemertal Token gives access to only one Application. It's dedicated Web Gui to interact with the Application for which the Token has permissions
